name: Skyline Lentil Chili
author: Cair
summary: Serve chili over spaghetti and top with chopped onion, finely shredded Cheddar cheese, kidney beans, and Tabasco® sauce. I used to love Skyline Cincinnati-style chili. When I went vegetarian I came up with this Skyline lentil chili to give me that Skyline taste. I use green or black lentils as the protein where standard Cincinnati-style would use ground meat. Even though I've gone back to eating meat this is still my preferred way to get my Skyline fix.
ingredients: 2 tablespoons chili powder, or more to taste
½ (1 ounce) square unsweetened chocolate, grated
1 tablespoon olive oil, or as needed
½ cup water, or as needed  (Optional)
directions: Mix chili powder, garlic powder, unsweetened chocolate, cinnamon, cumin, salt, cayenne pepper, allspice, cloves, and bay leaf together in a bowl until seasoning mix is well combined
Heat olive oil in a Dutch oven over medium heat; cook and stir onions and green bell pepper until lightly browned, about 10 minutes
Add vegetable broth and lentils; simmer for 20 minutes
Stir in seasoning mix, tomato sauce, apple cider vinegar, and Worcestershire sauce; simmer for 1 hour more, adding water if chili gets too thick
Blend chili using an immersion blender until desired consistency is reached
